revised_title: The Preparation and Properties of Oxygen through Electrolysis of Baryta
tldr: The authors describe the preparation of oxygen through the electrolysis of baryta using nickel electrodes. They discovered that over time, hydrogen begins to appear alongside oxygen, which can be prevented by coating the anode with a layer of black oxide of nickel. The authors also discuss the possible mechanisms behind this phenomenon and the presence of hydrogen peroxide in the liquid around the anode.
